text: HS4000, named Kestrel, was a prototype high-powered mainline diesel locomotive built in 1968 by Brush Traction to demonstrate its wares to British Railways. The name came from Hawker Siddeley (the owner of Brush) 4000 hp (the power rating of its Sulzer engine). HS4000 Category:Brush Traction locomotives Category:Co-Co locomotives
title: British Rail HS4000
